fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • In a leader column about “flight shame” we said that the International Air Transport Association expects global air traffic to double to “around 8.2bn flights annually” by 2037. That figure actually relates to the expected number of passengers, not flights (Movements such as flight shaming have an important part to play, 18 January, page 2, Journal). • Other recently corrected articles include: Deutsche Welle staff speak out about alleged racism and bullying Simply by defying the tabloids, Meghan has already beaten them Cocktail of the week: Blacklock’s non-alcoholic old fashioned
